FuncDef:
The radius-attribute agent-circuit-id format command configures the format of packets that inform the upstream device of the link ID.
The undo radius-attribute agent-circuit-id format command restores the default setting.
By default, the packets that inform the upstream device of the link ID are in the cn format.

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates the tr-101 format. The format is NAS_slot/NAS_subslot/NAS_port:XPI.XCI regardless of link types.
-

Indicates that the packets that inform the upstream device of the link ID are in the cn format. for an Ethernet link, the format is slot/port[:vlan-id].
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
You can configure the format of packets that inform the upstream device of the link ID by using the radius-attribute agent-circuit-id format command.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
